sen.j: 女御（にょうご）は、天皇の後宮の身位の一つで、天皇の寝所に侍した。
sen.e: Nyogo was a rank of consort of the emperor, which was in charge of attending on the emperor in his bedroom.
Nyogo was one of the ranks and titles of the imperial consorts in the pre-modern days of Japan, and its role was to attend on the emperor in his bedroom.

sen.j: 名称は、中国（周）の官制を記した書「周礼」に由来する。
sen.e: The word 'Nyogo' originated from the book 'Shurai', which described about the governmental organizations of China (Zhou.)

sen.e: The rank of Nyogo followed Kogo and Chugu.

sen.j: 初見は「日本書紀」雄略天皇の条であるが、実際は桓武天皇のとき紀乙魚（き の おとな）・百済王教法などを女御としたのに始まる。
sen.e: The word 'Nyogo' first appeared in the article about Emperor Yuryaku in 'Nihonshoki', but in fact, KI no Otona and Kudaranokonikishi kyoho who were made Nyogo during the reign of Emperor Kanmu were the beginning of Nyogo.

sen.j: はじめ位は低かったが、その位は次第に高まり、平安時代中期以降、皇后は女御から昇進する慣例となった。
sen.e: The rank of Nyogo was low at first but gradually raised, and after the middle of the Heian period, it became customary that Kogo was promoted from Nyogo.

sen.e: Asako KUJO (Eisho kotaigo) who was Nyogo of Emperor Komei, was the last Nyogo.

sen.e: There was not a prescribed number for Nyogo, and when there were several Nyogo, they were called after the name of the palace they lived like 'Jokyoden Nyogo.'

sen.j: 応仁の乱以後、中宮昇進のための儀式の捻出が困難になると、摂家出身の后妃といえども女御に留まる場合が多くなる。
sen.e: After the Onin War, even consorts who came from the regent families increasingly chose to remain in the rank of Nyogo, because it became difficult to put together a sum of money for the ceremonies they would hold when they were to be promoted to Chugu.
